-tcXDnrG1tc8XRTqZ3JdTw.text: Uninspired bland sports bar. It has a very stupid name, it's weirdly laid out, the waitstaff are joyless zombies, and it has a surprisingly small beer list, but the food is good and served quickly. It has the advantage of being the only restaurant within 2 miles of the adjacent hotel.

9s--CS-94JOsv0tiKNeLFA.text: I stopped in here this week, for the first time in years to catch the Wofford vs. Wisconsin basketball game.  It was about 3:00pm, and only the bar side of the building was being seated. Can I say it was an utterly chitty experience, and leave it at that?

wK06yc8ug0_M2Yr0wSQdXg.text: The food is not bad here but the service usually is awful. I have worked near Jocks and Jill's for over 8 years and has eaten there often. However, I go less frequently and probably will not return. The past 9 out of ten times, the service is beyond awful. My last visit was on Friday, 4/10 and I went for a late lunch, arriving around 2 p.m. Of course the dining area was closed and a sign stated to site at the bar area or outside. We chose to site at a two top in the bar area. There were only a few other patrons there. The server finally took our drink order and gave use menus.  She then dropped the drinks off and took our food order. A food runner dropped our food off. My friend had to flag someone else down since her order was incorrect. Once again, I received poor service and they were not busy at all. I guess it is normal for the servers to think they do not have to put in an effort when they are not busy. She never refilled my drink nor came back to check on us. My friend had to flag her down to get a to go box. I asked for a to go cup and the server asked did I want it filled up, after looking at my empty drink. To make matters worse, there was a gnat flying around and finally in my food, so I only ate half my salad. I am sure the server saw me swatting but cared less. Needless to say she got no tip and lost two customers. I am sure this review will make no difference to the business since I have complained several times online and got no response. Before I have sat outside and the server actually forgot about us.  Again, had to get up and flag server down. There is NEVER a manager present.

jU5WZ4TRJxB5P0lpeyIqug.text: Holy TVs. They are absolutely everywhere. If you can't watch your favorite team in this place I don't know what to tell you. I only came here for a few beverages to watch NFL. An alright selection of beers on tap, I can't complain they had an IPA on tap. I actually had a mixed drink as well, which was pretty tasty and strong. Service was friendly and attentive and the bar area was very full.

uWryZ9sxbAwLmyJplLg6vg.text: Ate dinner here tonight. Service was a little slow but the food was good. It's a sports bar so the usual memorabilia and flat screens all over. Again, it's a bar so don't expect a Morton's or a McCormick and Schmick.

gQWnDAtb0qArKHVsioJNWQ.text: we were in town for 3 nights and ended up eating here twice great bar food exactly what i expect, what more can a guy ask for!

47iAZI8bZpFKnr5_Eppdvw.text: Great place to watch sports.  Pretty good service and food is ok for bar food.  Would agree with the others that it is a little out of the way.

VFcG6_BGSwVcUVGkWDxcOQ.text: Jocks and Jills is a very clean sports bar with a decent menu. It is a bit lacking in the beer selection. Excellent place to go for lunch, and would be great for watching football games. The drawback here is the location; it's in the middle of nowhere. There is really NOTHING else on this road other than office buildings, and that's about it. So of course it draws mainly a corporate crowd, which is a shame, because True sports fans are missing out.

qUJT-3T3VJMPeiEHBcir1Q.text: I came to Jocks & Jills to watch football on a Sunday.  If you are looking to catch any or every NFL game this is a good place to go.  Didn't count the exact number, but enough flat screens so that each game was up on at least 2 TV's.  Each TV was labled with the game so it makes it easy to find the game you are interested in and get a seat.  There were quite a few people there watching the games and the atmosphere was good.  Everyone was friendly and chatted about their teams and plays from the different games going on.  I orderd the chicken wings with along with onion rings.  Pretty standard wings, the sauce was pretty good, but the wings were a little over cooked, but still good.  The onion rings were probably frozen, but still OK for me.  The had some beer specials going on which is pretty standard.  The service was OK too, the only mishap was the server brought blue cheese for my wings instead of ranch, but she quickly got me a ranch when I told her about the mistake.  You typical chain sports bar.  The food was OK but, I would probably go back here for the TV's and atmosphere.

niH-HP7DByRvI0_rHRu8NA.text: My new favorite sports bar. If you are a hockey fan, this place is amazing. They have several pieces of memorabilia including an autographed Mark Messier Jersey and stick signed by Jaromir Jagr. The food was amazing and prompt and good value. Try the meatloaf.

bxrd60QeLx6qZ1T995zC9Q.text: Disappointing chicken nachos and steak salad.  Atmosphere great, but food not worth the price.  Chicken use to be pulled with little bit of kick, but this chicken was chunks with no taste.  Steak salad was more like cucumber salad and for $14 expected more.

uP6UgK7tJmgUQZezdujVlg.text: This place was awesome! I had never been and a friend told me about it. The burger was great and the atmosphere was fun. Not to mention Emily took such good care of us! I'll definitely be back to see her! She's awesome!

Hxngsy85CuTOweqJfcEIvQ.text: It's a regular sports bar - don't expect too much. I will say that this is useful in that it's across a hotel that you're put up in if you have to stay in Charlotte. The bartender was pretty nice and the prices are decent. My only issue was the crowd is a little questionable as there is also a random apartment complex across the street.  I ordered the salmon and veggie salad which was decent - the salmon was well made and the veggies were grilled. The salad itself was basic. I also had a glass of there house merlot for $7. They do have a lot of variety so if you're craving a burger or wings, it's probably the place to go.

t0OHL_E9r1m4YLfBT1I0kg.text: I was staying in Charlotte and didn't want hotel food. The airport shuttle driver suggested that we try here. It was above average, and better than the hotel

pLLaASW7tUFva8rUQaf4mg.text: Good food and awesome service. great place to eat h Sunday football! Management comes to visit customers and staff is the same for several years. Speaks volumes!

m-HPulSZlzT6OJ0PzIS3PQ.text: Good spot for beer sports and food. I've been here 3 days in a row while on business in the area. Great food and close to the local hotels.  Trivia night tonight. Great ambiance. I'm guessing I'll be back tomorrow (trivia pun!!).   Plus: Fat Tire on tap. A treat for a Canadian who can't get Fat Tire at home. Cheers!

I5zndvjesdAJzAmFxA_XqQ.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of this place.  I figured basic bar food but it was much better. I got the Kickin chicken sandwich.   Probably the best buffalo style chicken sandwich I've ever had.   They use a special hand made breading on there chicken that was really tasty.  A nice spice but not too hot.  Seems like a basic bar food menu, just done with higher quality ingredients and experienced cooks.    A ton of nice TVs, lots of high tops, and a good selection of beers on draft too.   Exactly what a good sports bar should be.

Epvv3_m8d5d9vHDzTXOmig.text: Nice place to go afterwork for a drink or to catch a game but average food fare    better places to go for meal

W2aDUcQ8GQIt6vKdjlwDXw.text: One if my favorite places to eat when I'm in CLT! Courteous service. Food is always prepared as ordered, and they give a 25% to airline employees! Close to the airport and many hotels it's a great place for visitors and locals alike!

N9YiuO0CeHT3uz0-OZezYQ.text: We had stayed at the Hyatt and was hungry after our drive so we decided to try this place out it was later in the evening on a Tuesday and I have to say we were not disappointed. The place is your typical sports type bar with tons of tv's all around and We were greeted by a nice guy who was our waiter forgive me i forgot his name but he waited on us right away got us our drinks and took our order. I had the pulled pork sandwich, my husband got the sliders and my daughter had the steak and our played were licked clean (not literally) but the food was delish. I would definitely come back the next time we are in town!

NhcnRgWVyUx0kzbNTUs5XA.text: Very Close to work so its just a 5 min drive for me so I thought I would give this place a shot...  This is a typical sports bar. If you are inside (or outside) there are TV's throughout the place. I don't see thing place as extra-ordinary but it is still a good place to come and get a fairly quick lunch without breaking the bank.  Its not really a takeout place although I'm sure you can but mostly sit-down atmosphere with daytime workers frequenting the place..  The food was actually good and I just had a Beer and burger.  During most lunch hours it did not seem too crowded, they had outside seating and courteous service..   I would visit again..

SnJ1NOBSgt9sYmytLX76aQ.text: When ever we are in Charlotte we make an effort to get over to this restaurant.  We can count on good food and plenty of choices. Helpful that it's not far from airport.  Atmosphere is warm wood with entertaining sports memorabilia abounding. My pre-teen kids just love it.  One is picky, likes mostly salads and she can always find something on the menu (phew!)  Love the BBQ ribs and pulled pork.   Burgers are big and tasty too. Couple steps above bar food for sure.  Don't care for the cole slaw unfortunately (pretty plain). ok servers, typically friendly but there are a few that are just so-so. This trip we had Sean who was wonderful. Lots of TV for those who like that. And I (not a TV or sports fan)

uF1KU6kr5G_Jui_TZtKfzw.text: Wow did this place suck. I came here for lunch with a work collesfur. I am from out of town but this was the closest place and it did nothing for me. Dirty interior, poor service. I just got a chicken salad and it was not memorable.

AT_aJTSvC1PDvOB3x72dYg.text: Good if your travelling, & staying nearby. Service wasn't great, not horribile either. You are getting what you pay for here.

d_8K1aPy0sT6Dt05_Dm-eg.text: Service was prompt at the bar. Already had dinner in town. Had two draft beers and woke with horrible headache. Clean the tap lines?

7iRnRG1iQvsQlrio4LhBZg.text: Hands down, THE BEST SOUPS IN CHARLOTTE! I've been coming here for lunch for over a year and this place rocks! Friendly staff - try the soup!!!

WJgPOdRhJdA06lovJ7RlCw.text: Ordered a simple grilled chicken salad. Over half the salad were stems, some of which had turned brown. Not at all worth the $9 I spent for a bed of lettuce stems.

iIz7MMhZDxAQ91i8Me-2ug.text: The Minick's Family was here on Friday August 5,2016. We had a great time and the waiter was the best.

BsnNVGChf-cmGE_LJX_vDg.text: Came in because it was on the same lot as my hotel.  Sat at the bar.  Had great service and the bartenders where very friendly and attentive.  Good place to have a beer, food and watch a game with friends or alone.  Will definitely come back!  Food was good and big portions.

dROGct_DwSka2VVV4OU3jg.text: My fave quick stop. I like to come here, get good food and a couple beers. The service is always good and I am always satisfied with food. I would recommend this to a friend. Family environment as well.

Fbrm_s6a3fkXrvTNaAsktQ.text: We are from California and we just landed and went straight here. They were so nice and the food was excellent. We had the best server. Over all this place was amazing. So impressed!

zpCDM9LLxIhtZMQgnkcZmw.text: Oh boy... I was traveling with colleagues who had eaten here before so I went with the flow when they suggested we stop here for a late dinner upon landing in NC. It's minutes away from Charlotte airport so that's a plus, but that's really the only thing it had going for it. I ordered the Swiss cheese and mushroom burger with no bun and a side salad rather than fries. What I got was a Swiss cheese and mushroom burger with no bun with some iceberg lettuce. It was comical. No lettuce, tomato, or onion was on the plate as was in the description. Maybe they consider a pile of iceberg lettuce a side salad? Either way, I'm going to do everything in my power to not eat here again next time we travel to NC! Also, every single stool was wobbly and the bathrooms were pretty messy.

3TSrS70VE6nqnFSgokUkKA.text: The drinks are weak but cheap if they were stronger I would give them 5 stars cause the food especially the fried shrimp Decore  and location is on point I'll be back

R2aLh_LYC98FNV5aUQDZMg.text: Food is great, but service sucked. Our waitress never cleared appetizers off the table. Two other waitresses ended up bringing us food because for some reason our waitress was preoccupied. Two stars because the food was good, but again, service sucked.

pJTyfXXF3G2JQw1G6gI_BQ.text: I was very disappointed in the service and in the quality of food here. The wife and I were up from SC for a night out. We got our drinks rather quickly but it took forever for the waitress to take our food order. When the food did come, it was mediocre. I ordered a chicken sandwich and a beer and my wife ordered onion rings and a strong bow. That was literally the last time I saw my waitress. She had our section and the patio area. Why would you not schedule more help on a Friday night?? Poor customer service and shame on management for not preparing better. Warm beer and mediocre food. Not what I was expecting!!!!

UfAvL911ykyvTfdmVkpXNA.text: Good sports bar with bigger menu variety. Service is friendly and fast. Not too loud on weekdays but don't know what it's like on weekends.

Qv6R9DhbmZVDm3w2mMH_yg.text: Fantastic lunch menu. My fav is BBQ Chicken pizza/house salad combo. Delicious!    Tons of TVs around the bar. They label the TVs with what game will be on which is nice. Staff is awesome!   Large outside covered patio with a few heaters (though only one works now) and several TVs (small ones).

photos.caption: Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great lunch combos

KkOySjfM9FSY_DsdnzKIIg.text: Food is so-so (typical bar food) but the service is great so I will keep coming back. They are getting rid of the southwestern menu so I am not sure what I will order as I typically get the nachos. I am hoping new menu items will be added soon.

fwsiTHCk4hoZsCOqlBdGeA.text: I was in there a couple weeks ago with some work associates for an after work get together. I probably had 15 in the group. We were greeted at the front with smiles and shown to our table. We had a server (Kaitlyn) who was very kind and energetic, who easily put up with our hustle and sarcasm and gave us some back. We had a great time of laughter and fun! The food and drinks were great and on timers well (considering how busy everyone seemed)! We will definitely be back again!

7W3upG5VbZt4LLsVfaaQfw.text: Jocks and Jill's is your typical sports bar. They have numerous TVs all playing different games. I came to watch a specially aired college football game so we had a nice private room and our own waitress.   There wasn't anything special about it. The food was good, typical beer selection. One nice thing about it is the location. Since it is off the beaten path, it's not crazy crowded like most sports bars on a Saturday and Sunday.

GyNP282zZBB6twlTmOHqJA.text: Here's where they lost the stars:  Service: Horrible! Please do us all a favor and if you do not want to work with people, skip the interview where any customer interaction is required. The hostess looked at my group of six like we had three eyes when we asked for our table. Seriously?  When we were finally seated our waitress came out and threw our coasters down on the table and asked for our drink orders. Seriously? When it was time to take our order, she  barely gave us time to finish saying what we wanted before she was on to the next person. Again, Seriously?  Food: The fries were cold AGAIN. One time, okay maybe it's a fluke. But the SECOND time makes it the "norm" within your location. Unacceptable. The burger was overcooked and dry...Just No, no, no!  The whole thing just seem like an inconvenience...for everyone. I didn't enjoy myself or the food.  It will be a while before I give this place another chance.

KSfo6Cms_AELCU3dUY-3pA.text: Was in town on business for a couple of days. Great environment, great service. Diamond was our bartender and she took care of us. Great drinks!

ytF54vpZNTmBaZT9bR6SpQ.text: This is really a fan sports bar. Menu isn't very large but wings were really good. Excellent place to watch a ball game. Tons of TVs and management will get the ball game on TV that you want to watch.

8XXnTWJxJK_QV1VAkB204A.text: Seems like your average sports bar when you walk in, but they seem to find some redeeming qualities. Food was great and at a good price. Our server (Shaun, I think) suggest we try their honey mustard grilled chicken sandwich. It was great and the same price as their chicken sandwich without cheese or bacon. I also had a cup of their clam chowder and it was superb! Shawn took great care of us. The place was obviously busy, but he was prompt and even took the time to chat with us. I would give five stars, but the decor was very, VERY dated and dark. The wood paneling we sat next to seemed to be peeling off the wall and there were stains on the carpet near us. They decor just makes you feel gross. Paint the walls brighter and get rid of that old carpeting and this place would be the perfect spot.

L0RqgugWQrkJuDXmDKNwcw.text: The description said..."cheesy creamed spinach served with warm chips".  What I received was "milky spinach served with room temperature chips".  The dip would not even sit on the chip. It ran off. Nothing remained on the chip. The chips were fresh though.  I used to enjoy this restaurant and the atmosphere.  It's not the same.  There was no service with a smile nor was there a thank you please come again. Just my bill and the server disappeared. That's exactly what I'll do...and I won't return.

photos.caption: Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. This is the Globetrotter&#39;s Spin Dip

TyabNQEicf_eUcoc3jPObg.text: Boy it's been a long day and I see a place close to the hotel that's open!! Talk about it... Walked in hostess told me to be seated. Waitress came I've and asked me what I wanted. Guy walks over with the menu and says kitchen is closed... I looked down at my watch... it was 11:08... At most restaurants the kitchen closes 30mins before close of the business...

T7Dcik_2ZB3_S6mq4zm2eg.text: I have been to J&J's dozens of times. The food is above average, wings, sandwiches, burgers, soups and appetizers have never disappointed. Service has always been very good. Great place to watch sports or relax on the patio.

6qr1oPYL_x2L6342XdFUGw.text: This place is just blah.  We went here on a weekday evening, and it was not crowded.  There were 8 in our group and the staff said we could go sit outside.  They didn't have anything open elsewhere, but from the looks of it there were plenty of seats available inside.  We mentioned it would be cold outside, but they said they had heaters out there (they were not on and would not come on when we tried to get them on).  There are plenty of tv's outside - only 2 were large flat screen, while others were small tubes.  I agree with one of the other reviewers how the staff members are like zombies, they are not very responsive.  Service was extremely slow for a slow night at the restaurant.  Took awhile for everything from getting menus outside, then drinks, food, and eventually our bill.  Food is very bland, lacking good flavor.  I was wanting a combination of the chicken and burger sliders - you get 4 of the sliders (I wanted 2 of each chicken and burger) and both are the same price, but they would not combine the two.  So Kevin and I just got the chicken sliders and split them.    It was a convenient place for us at the time, but there are plenty of better sports bars in the area with better tasting food and service.

CD5mUkvYf9y6Avrk-J3QGQ.text: I don't know anything about their food because I never made it that far... My husband works right down the street so we decided to go there on his 1 hour lunch break. We walked in and waited at the front counter for about 5 minutes or so, the hostess finally walked up appearing as if we were disturbing her, we told her we needed a table for 2 and she dropped the bomb "it will be about 20 minutes before we have a table available".  The place did not seem to be super busy and we would have sat at the bar if that were an option because by the time we got back in the car and drove to another location to eat, lunch was almost over!! So needless to say, our once a month lunch together was ruined and we ended up with fast food in the car so he would not be late getting back to the office.  Moral of the Story: Don't Eat HERE if you only have 1 hour for lunch!!!

P708otyibviRLT5eqxQvZQ.text: I had read reviews that the customer service was not good, but we wanted something close to the airport. I must say that the customer service was actually awesome and our waiter Sean was extremely attentive. The manager even checked on our table twice. Way to go in exceeding expectations and giving A+ service !

-k9oQoWZVSnI9XlUG4rf3A.text: I would have to say that this place is really in line with most of the other restaurants of this genre. Medicore to OK food, nothing spectacular. Staff is always friendly, and I would assume that they pull a LOT of business from the hotel that shares the same parking lot.  The drink specials are always a domestic and never anything special. All in all, it's a decent place to grab a quick bite, but don't go in expecting juicy burgers or stellar wings.

v11jtYuPH6n2JTm2kD8Sow.text: Jocks and Jills is kind of out of the way, but being that I used to live off Tyvola Road, it was fairly convenient to visit on occasion.  It's an A-OK restaurant with some beer specials and your regular bar food like burgers, sandwiches, salads, etc.  Nothing really stands out, but sometimes that's okay.  Sometimes you just want regular bar food and a few brewskies.  And Jocks and Jills fills the bill.  One thing I like about the restaurant is its high ceilings.  It doesn't make you feel as confined as other restaurants, and there is a lot of seating.  I'm surprised they've been able to stay in business because I never see it very busy, but I hope they'll be able to stick it out until they do something with the old Coliseum area.  It would be nice to have a "neighborhood bar" still there.

eaNzefkWeBdGJQI4GO5_3Q.text: After two long days of business we decided to eat near our hotel and this was the only option. It is a bar and bar food. At first we sat at the bar since there was a private party on the patio but asked the hostess to let us know when we could move outside since she said it was wrapping up. The tables at the bar are sticky! The server said, yeah they are just like that. Gross! Thankfully a minute later we were able to move to the patio. Actually really nice out there. Our server was very sweet too. Actually everyone was very friendly there a big plus! Some good beers on draft and my boss got a lemon drop martini she really enjoyed. We started with the spinach dip. This was weirdly very watery. Not sure why...tasted meh...my boss ordered the steak salad and I got the club sandwich. The food was average which is actually fine by me at a bar. As long as it is decent that is what is to be expected. The dip was a little off but meals not bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Club no Swiss
Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spinach dip

KpmgCNx-r38PpKLNaJktNQ.text: Great place to watch ANY sport in event! Tons of televisions that air pretty much anything requested. Good beer selection, and a standard bar-type menu (wings, burgers, etc.). Highly recommended for the avid sports fan who enjoys a cold one and some decent food!

a0epCdkoBI6IgOvXzWUFPw.text: Don't be fooled. Ate there three times (was staying at hotel nearby) and all were at best substandard. The ONLY reason to go here is for the televised games. I mean how can you mess up a philly steak and cheese!

yS7Oe5VMHak_t9KByVTdEQ.text: Pretty fun atmosphere. Came here on a Wednesday. This is your average sports bar but what really sets my visits apart is the bartender Nirm. Nirm always makes it his job to learn your name and remembers it every time you come in and is always very courteous and always has a smile on his face. He even checked outside when it was pouring for a guy who was waiting on the Marriott shuttle to come pick him up. Decent drink specials and food as well. I like their wings and salads. Haven't tried much else or sat anywhere else besides the bar mainly because of Nirm.

ZFZ1JLNGKRvdvZfoK-l0Mw.text: Great food and I happened to be there this past Sunday after not watching football all day until that evening. It was great checking out all of the games.

6wZSeYLdIhIQ2iuT_gQ4JQ.text: JJ's does the job.  If you are looking for an American bar food style restaurant with a million and one TVs.. Then you have come to right place.  The burgers and sandwiches are XL and the wings looked delicious.  Honestly, there wasn't a bad seat in the house.  I'm talking... TVs everywhere and at every angle.  You can't go wrong.  Only negative thing was that it has zero unique or creative qualities.  But at least you know that you are getting quality and comfort.  Enjoy  -Ian M.

YdBxisyKZTLiTKvML66gJg.text: More 2 1/2 stars that 3. I dined with three coworkers.  The food "we" ordered was just... meh. Some of the other plates coming out of the kitchen looked better. Two of us ordered the Salmon. Half of mine was dry. How they did that I do not know. The plate was missing the rice, so they brought me plate out quickly. It was gross and overcooked. Should have left it in the kitchen Another had a salad and that looked OK. The last diner had the fish tacos. He said they were just OK. The fish was good, but the rest of he ingredients were unimpressive. I added 1/2 star because a table next to us ordered several burgers and I saw a couple of the fried shrimp plates be delivered. THOSE looked good. But I will never go back and try them since I have a car and there are many more places that are better nearby.

vXkiOhb7I0LDNa7b2RQFtg.text: Atmosphere is great... Service is subpar... Waitress jacked up my order in many ways. Her customer service skills were a 3 on a scale 1-10. Each time she came to the table all she did would only ask my husband if she could get him anything else or how the food was. Wouldn't even make eye contact with me. Never filled my water glass once while He got 3 refills. I'll be sure not to come here or recommend this establishment to anyone in the are for the future. If the waitress had better interpersonal skills with with women then I would recommend this place if they had fixed my order. Hands down, as long as there is professional curtesy and great food, then to me, the atmosphere doesn't matter. Fix your employee's demeanor or have them get a different job.

WPr1WZNoAVO2LqFE27fXJw.text: Amazing food !! The blackened salmon reminded me of my hometown!! I would definitely recommend this sports bar..

YUzQOMjEyx4fejWE7lreag.text: Went here based on recommendation from the hotel. There wasnt much in the area. It was a friday night they didn't have the nba all star game on just olympic ice skating and the sports illustrated swimsuit awards as well as 20/20. The waitress constantly forgot things that we asked for. She did not know the menu. and the spicy lemon pepper wings were way to spicy to even taste the lemon pepper. I sent them back and I over heard the gentleman in the booth behind me send his back for the same reason. I did enjoy the sandwich and fries that I ordered afterwards. If im in the area again, I dont know if id go back, maybe if there are no other options.

fFfRZz_fsbetot7o9zrRhw.text: Ate here after covering the Ravens-Panthers game on Nov. 21 and the food was what you would expect from a sports-themed restaurant.   I will say that the mahi-mahi sandwich was quite good. But what sold me was the young bartender, who allowed my friend and I to order just before the kitchen closed for the night. And before we could finish our $1.50 Miller Lite drafts, he brought over freshly-filled mugs -- gratis. That kind of service is definitely worth a star.

qRZqeHYujzdLg_9UDUudKA.text: I was at the nearby Hyatt recently and went here for dinner.  I enjoyed the food and lively atmosphere.  And then I left my credit card there and didn't realize it until the next day when I got to the airport. So I called and got the manager "JJ" who said yes, they found it and he'd mail it to me. Sure enough, 3 days later I got it in the mail (in Connecticut) with a nice note.   Great customer service... thanks JJ!

RXzgJIsp4Hh6H_xgDeSScw.text: I came here last Friday with some colleagues. There were about 12 of us and we were served courteously and efficiently. We didn't have a lot of time but we were served quickly and were out in time to get back to work. The food was good and everyone left happy and full. I had the bowl of chili which was really good. It was a big serving and I wasn't able to finish the bowl. Next time I want to have the chili I think I will try the cup instead. All in all a great experience and I will continue to come for  lunch  with my colleagues.

hiTNcHypS6Icks051_qQOg.text: HORRIBLE!  I have gone to this restaurant more than once to give it a chance and each time I've been there, I have walked away disappointed. Their food isn't all that great. I've had their salad (the lettuce was brown in some spots and warm), chicken sandwich (which was EXTREAMLY dry), and a few appetizers that I wasn't a big fan of.   The last time I was there, an hour lunch turned into almost 2 hours and I wasn't even there during rush hour. The waiter I had (I forgot his name) had the, "I really don't want to be here today," attitude. He was very slow, probably waited a good 45 minutes just for a burger (my husband ordered) and a chicken sandwich (my order). When asked about the progress of the food, he just waved us off saying it's coming. When our meals finally came, they were cold and just nasty. It takes a lot for my husband to say, "ok, this doesn't taste good," but he refuses to go back.   I could keep going on about this, but Im sure you've gotten the picture already. If you're passing by and you've never been there before, keep going down the road, it's not worth it.

9MZUubXhHiZyB_AxGyBNiA.text: Good place to eat especially if you are staying right next door at the Hyatt! If you go there you have to get the tots! The original are very good and the sweet potato ones taste like more of a dessert, and they are just as good the next day cold! Lots come in 1 order so they are an easy share! They have a big variety choice on wing flavor!! They are tasty and filling!! They also have TVs everywhere so you an catch your game!

j-pVmPofOGppVJ1Z28SrLw.text: I used to come here years ago and thought it was an great sports bar. I stopped in on a Monday night and it was dead. There were only 5 people at the bar. In  their defense, it was a slow night for sports. MLB on the All Star break so no games were on the many HD TV's. The bartender was very good and took time to talk to the customers. I had 3 beers and bounced. I would definitely give in another try when I am in Charlotte.

n1JhkKbAHB9VAA1EZz8WdA.text: Here fans can find sports bar food, done in an ordinary fashion.  Television viewing was well thought out, even if the food is not.  You can literally see a TV no matter what seat you are in. I can't say I've ever been to a sports bar with good food.  Maybe it's too much to ask to want to watch the world cup and have a decent meal.

33FhHTcWgwg0FN88DIJu9Q.text: Wife and I had lunch here. We started off with the blue chips which were excellent. I had the turkey burger and she had the grilled chicken salad. Both were good except the chicken was extremely charred on the grill.   I would definitely eat here again though.

wTR7v1y6r1TvfE40grUFog.text: Food was excellent Great customer service. Love the place food is good also. Football season is near so I will be here for all the games

7HHhF6d2ONx5N5GVsOl1gw.text: We live in the apartment complex across the street so it's convenient to order to-go and pick it up. The food is always good. Never really had issues except their fries are a hit or miss. We usually order the philly cheese steak and a burger. The only annoying thing about ordering takeout is that the pickup is at the bar. It can be really chaotic so sometimes we're waiting to get a bartenders attention for 15 min, and it's awkward hovering behind customers sitting trying to get their attention. I wish they would move take-out to the front. Overall it's convenient and the food is worth the price you pay.

vdfmLcvZIjFLzpZapUMNVA.text: A lot of good bar food choices and definitely be back..i had the Nashville chicken sandwich

yjZ9P09sflNGmMgPAZgn8g.text: This is a nice little place with an awesome atmosphere. I had to try the wings and since I'm from Pittsburgh was very surprised when they came out "naked".  They were very tasty though. I also got the pot roast which isn't normally something I get but I was talked into by my waitress and I could see why. It was very good and you must get the coleslaw and mashed potatoes as your sides. I will definitely be back if I'm ever in town again.

55KG945FQPFk88Xb60U87A.text: Sports bar.  A stand alone sports themed place serving up your typical pub fare located close to the airport.  The place reminded me of a TGI Fridays and there was plenty of table seating and a large bar area.  Bartender was slow - considering that the place was quiet on a saturday afternoon, we would have expected a little more attention, but she was nice enough.  Decent sized menu with a pretty extensive selection of bar / pub favorites.  Food was fine: nothing mind blowing or memorable.  Everything came out in a reasonable amount of time and the prices were average for this type of establishment.  Overall a good spot to refuel, grab a cocktail and watch the game - there are tons of TV's scattered around the place.  Give it a shot if in the area.  Parking lot.

DpQdhUpZS7YiDoGDfURQYw.text: Good, very friendly service. Delicious food. From out of town and we came in to watch the hockey game. The tv was quickly changed when we requested it within view.

yrTI7P9u2XCgGetqDsSTAw.text: We stopped in here to have dinner one night when we were staying by the airport. It's the typical sports bar scene, complete with TVs and wooden high tops. The food was decent and plentiful, good sales of beers, and it was all very casual. We got an order of the sweet potato tots and they came with a side of brown sugar... delicious! However, the service was slow and the bathrooms were a complete mess. This is an okay place to stop if you don't want to travel too far from the airport. But, if you want a great meal with a nice atmosphere, I would not suggest this place.

hhLHG9nPwxJrHU9wCxODZg.text: Unfortunately this is a tale of two tales. First is the experience at the bar. Very attentive and good bar tenders. The second part of the story isn't so good. I ordered the ribs, the menu said fall off the bone. But when they bring you your ribs with a steak knife you know that can't be good. While cutting through the ribs I was worried I would slip down and my plate would go flying from pressing so hard down to try and cut through. They were so hard and dry it was sad. The bottom of the ribs were burnt black. I nibbled on them for a while because I couldn't be bothered sending them back and re-order. I still gave them a good tip because I ate at the bar and they were doing a good job. Please take your ribs off the menu, they make this place look really bad.

G3cm5UcWhcoYDHao7Kj9pg.text: Food was good and quick. The place was filthy. Server finally picked up the knife and napkins and straws in the floor.

photos.caption: Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

zFHxYQKcoCuuxlXhnlMZBA.text: Decent sports bar that is near where I work but never seems to be the first joint on my mind.    My wife and I came on a whim.  We heard they have great wings and I wanted wings. Yes they do. Very tasty and a good value.  The bar here is huge.  I wish more establishments had this much space to sit and enjoy all the TVs. Wow.  I could look left to right and see 6 different shows  Mike served us at the bar.  He rocks. Very polite and personable.  I like observant bartenders and Mike is the king.  Biggest drawback here for me is the beer selection. The drafts are weeks with the exception of the Sweetwater IPA and OMB Copper. The later is a fallback beer for me: just saying.    They have a semi-ok.  They had the NODA Hip Drop 'N Roll in cans.  Works for me in a pinch.    Lots of meeting space and breakout rooms.  Definitely a great place to hold an event.  Music is great, people are friendly and I like this place as a stop over.    All in all, I'll be back

xGSeQ6DIovbm7EP70Ny2Lg.text: Came in last night, it's was a party of 5. The server was friendly and very attentive. A friend ordered chips and salsa as the appetizer, and the salsa was very yummy. For dinner I opted for the "the Texas ranger" which is a rib eye with 2 sides.  I opted for the cesar salad as one of my sides and it was good. I ordered my ribeye med and mashed potatoes and gravy as my other side. The food was good, and the steak was definitely cooked to perfection. I'm a hard cider person, and my first time trying strong bow and I was impressed. There wasn't a wait and we were also seated promptly. I'd definitely return.

gkj_bIs0YExMZ_QlKgISow.text: Visiting NC for business and went to Jocks and Jill's since it was right next to our hotel, only a 2 minute walk away. Not a large menu, but friendly staff and good food. Overall not a bad place to stop and get lunch/dinner.

gAPOrbwFiBeB7J1f1CEwAQ.text: I have been here a few times with Work colleagues for lunch. I am completely underwhelmed. First impression  is that there is a strong off putting smell when you walk into the restaurant. The food is always sub par- todays salad was frozen to the bottom of my plate.

Wl7GeMRqxmMmrdRAeh5FTw.text: Had a great afternoon experience with my wife. Want to thank Courtney for taking great care of us. Love the wings here and checking out the Cajun chicken

Ura3CFReF9cknOMN9j5jWw.text: Typical let you down cheap franchise food with less than stellar service. A bit loud, too. Had their $18 fried shrimp dinner and tasted it ALL night. First and last time for this greasy over rated joint. Skip this place.

9BNw8VKvCF-yGIY7cm1yOA.text: For a sports bar food was beyond expectation.  Great beer selection, fresh and very cold.  Nice atmosphere and good sports vibe.

jBfLaNgNPplUebEGw2yAyw.text: Worst service I have ever experienced along with finding two pieces of black hair in my food.  I ordered ONE beer and they charged me for two. The margaritas have maybe a splash of tequila in it. The food was mediocre. The manager was extremely rude and did not care. I do not recommend this place.

XHiVXf7l_1viJfcMDszlgw.text: The service sucked, I ordered a mixed salad and got Caesar salad. The wings were over cooked. I ordered ranch and got blue cheese?  The ribs were dry. Wow.   Not sure what else to say.

Ftcs0yw_IAw_6PHE6ZXMMg.text: Always come in here if I'm close by to grab a nice cold cold beer on draft. Great selection and they always have pretty good specials.

w7ld95EK4CQKgXM62H2qcg.text: Don't bother: We arrived at 3:40,  were not greeted, sat ourselves in the bar area as signs indicated, then waited for menus and service. After 15 minutes of waiting and absolutely no acknowledgment of our existence we decided to leave. On the way out we noticed two servers who were counting their tips and complaining to each other-- what else would you expect?! Don't waste your time being ignored or disrespected... go somewhere worthy of your business.

0DL9gdukLqUO9jEOSDzVBg.text: A good steak salad, and above average potato skins.  The ambiance is straightforward, comfortable sports bar and grill, with wood and green leather.  The service was very friendly, prompt and helpful.  All in all, a very enjoyable lunch, and would come back again.

SAImMnTAJdb4pkYO19rYyA.text: Update: I've come here twice after work recently and the evening atmosphere at night is way better. They have trivia and the service is a lot better and it's just a cool little place to grab a beer when waiting out local traffic. I added a star for that.  Original review: I eat here often for lunch, maybe once a month for awhile now, since it's close to work. I would say that the food is not bad but it's not wonderful. It's average. It's a good place to sit and have a beer during lunch, but I wouldn't recommend it for dinner unless you want to just eat while you watch sports and/or drink.  The main problem is inconsistent service. About 60 percent of the time, the service is ok. The rest is the time? Slowwww. I never come when it's busy either so it's just a matter of inattentive servers. I'm always wondering where they've gone or what on Earth they are doing aside from barely attending to the one or two tables in their respective sections.   My co-workers avoid this place due to this reason, but I still will come alone from time to time when I'm tired of everything else in the area.   There are a lot of TV's and a rather sizable bar. It always seems clean and organized. I'd say this place is ok. Not bad, not great, just ok.

R-huO4PxMogk_0PHHPyn6w.text: Burgers were really good, seasoned very well and done exactly how we asked them.  The staff and manager were all very nice and went out of their way to make sure we had a good dining experience.  Very reasonably priced for what we got and quality of food.  Thanks for a terrific dinner!

jtLHEUYiJ9zf5ejG9132oA.text: Ok, not bad for as close to the office it is. It has a range of choices. Service at the bar to pick up was nice and he accuracy of the order was decent (they forgot the extra blue cheese and extra crackers) and they also forgot it the 1st time I came it. The hostess was nice and showed me where to pick up the "to-go" orders. Burgers are good, fries were good, they have a kids menu so it's ok to bring the family. They have TVs and the place seem clean. Overall decent meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

xbt9w6mjWEEg-d63uDlsqQ.text: How a sports bar chooses to play generic music over game sound on the opening night of college basketball season completely blows my mind, but hey it's not my sports bar.  At least now I know where NOT to go if I want to hear sound for UNC basketball games.

gz__LsqOK7ftQXFB5ML_uQ.text: I've been coming here for college football Saturdays for the past few years now. I think they've earned another star.   I'm a fan of the burgers here. They are huge! The menu item you wouldn't think to order here- the fish tacos. My server recommended them and I was pleasantly surprised. They also have tater tots as a side item. Why don't all restaurants have toys?! App-wise, I like their wings and the chips with queso and homemade salsa.   I love how friendly the staff is here. The servers all know our group members by name. They take really great care of us.   Jocks is the home of both Nebraska (Go Huskers!) and North Dakota State watch sites. The bar is always full of people during college football games. They've got a ton of TVs. Nice sports bar option if you're in this part of town.

photos.caption: Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mushroom - swiss Burger

zKv9NIcwYAj0NFGDx1TEmw.text: I will preface this by saying we were here during the tropical storm. The food menu was limited and the service was ok until the attitude when we questioned the price of our pitiful sandwiches. The wings were decent, but a little pricey for the quality($21.99 for 20)Scott the manager was very polite and willing to adjust our bill. Our waitress got an attitude and acted like it was our fault for not picking a side the she mentioned when telling us the menu, but not asking what sides we wanted with our sandwhich. Our chips were from a bag, for $6 chips, salsa and queso. Lots of TVs, great for watching football. We tipped her over 20% despite my objection.

qBV29eSY-QtA8P3aZh_7Mg.text: The chicken sandwich got me right for a 10 bucks. Awesome sports atmosphere, watched my Capitals win the Stanley cup game 5. Hahaha, great environment and ever better tater tots.

photos.caption: Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon pepper please !
Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Sandwich !!! HELLO

g1WUXFoXi0LH5p0sObcUZQ.text: To be honest, I eat here weekly and it's great! The atmosphere is sports bar / restaurant and the food is excellent! Service is fast and friendly. I order salmon or steak and both are great.  They don't have a lot of GF options but the fish and steak are always a go to.  I highly recommend if your looking for a laid back casual dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mahi Mahi

i_V_FGTxEIUQhQjSv_9ZPg.text: Food was good Service was excellent Glasses - Dirty Silverware- Dirty  Have been there several times for work lunches, and staff is always great.  Just put off this last time by tableware that was not clean

OSGHeZjixquRu38EigI31g.text: I Forgot how  flavorful the wings were!  Yummy!! Will definitely be back. Winning combo of good food and great service.

Y6HKoB0_1EkPtr77sgcGdg.text: I would never recommend this place to anyone....ever. I sat at the bar for 5 mins. Watched a guy and a girl walking back and forth. The girl finally stopped and asked if I had been help. I said, "No". She took my drink order and asked if I was going to eat something. I said "Yes". She handed be a menu and walked away. I sat there for an entire hockey period (20+ mins). The girl never stopped back by and the guy never looked my direction. (asked the guy next to me if he wanted another drink, but never looked at me) After the period was over, I threw cash on the bar for my drink and left. Never placed an order...nothing. I will never return nor recommend this place to anyone. If you gave this place a good review, you must have low expectations of a sports bar.

BzTDjaS6FX6VK8F5ohHc7g.text: Excellent food and large portions! Atmosphere is clean and friendly! Will look for Jocks &Jills in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Excellent! Plenty of good!
Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Excellent!

kwSAU5kZCY4HVda-qr4g2A.text: Went to try out TopGolf but the wait was HOURS, so we jumped on our smart phones and hit up a sports bar instead.   Tv's are plentiful, and even though there was no big event on, we had fun watching old football shows and reminiscing about the Panthers.   Our server was great; friendly and attentive but not hovering.  The food leaves you wanting better sports bar food. The nachos were tasty, but on really flimsy chips. The spinach dip was more of a fake tasting cheese sause than a fresh spinach dip. My burger (ordered medium) was more on the rare side, and the French fries left me questioning, "should I have just gotten a side salad?" It's a traditional sports bar menu that lacks some originality and flair.   You'll have a great time and eat a ton of calories! Just leave room for when you want REAL good bar food later.

eKkQMT5LQpmHN-_QVECmtA.text: This is an alright place to eat at and enjoy a beer. It's typical bar food and the drinks are average. It's not anything special here, but nothing I would try and avoid either. I wouldn't go out of my way to go here, but would return if some friends wanted me to meet them there. The place is very spacious with many TVs for games.

photos.caption: Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

9K7jbwNaYsp-pT0U_s1noQ.text: Food was ok, we had the spinach and artichoke dip for the appetizer and it was lacking flavor, my son got grilled cheese which didn't look grilled all the way through, my husband got the crispy chicken sandwich, and he said it was super salty, and I had the salmon which was dry and flavorless, along with the vegetables, the potatoes were the only thing that had some kind of taste and was just ok still, was in town visiting and will definitely rethink this option again before going.

uuhXBYgRieAswGZEYm_jsA.text: The food was great. I had the Spicy chicken nachos and my sister had the brisket platter.  The service was really good also. Friendly environment and we were welcomed by a great staff.

mnJfDAro9KeMn1UbuZSy8w.text: I spent 20 minutes waiting for water after I sat down.  It never came. I actually asked the manager for the water and a Jack and Coke.  I waited patiently for 20 minutes.   I left and enjoyed another trip to McKoy's.  I never had a chance to try the food.  My suggestion is to avoid this place.

gtR4XcaGLvWJ_VML9qxILQ.text: Good place to eat. In the area for the weekend place for acriss from hotel. We had an amazing waitress. Wings was so good and the ribs fell off the bone. Lol

aCxopOpQZ2ApgS8WtTTQvA.text: So I found myself in Charlotte tonight. I was out by the airport so I stopped into this place that I have been to a few times in the past. The place is always consistent they have a great happy hour and the service is always good. Morgan was my server tonight I sat in the bar area and she was quick and attentive. The food came out fast and the drinks were quick as well. I ordered a Philly steak sandwich that Morgan had suggested. I'm glad she did the meet was tender the hoge was soft and the Philly was outstanding.  This place is only about 10 minutes from the actual airport entrance with traffic. So if you are around at the Charlotte airport and you're looking for some good food, because there are not many restaurants in this area please stop in to this place you will not be disappointed.

hpv7QHNkBwugQF98do80pw.text: 5 of us had dinner. We ordered beers, no appetizers. Went straight to entrees'. I had the full rack of ribs. It was quite large, great flavor. Came with a side salad, fairly standard. For sides I had the baked beans and cole slaw. The beans were good, the cole slaw seemed lacking on flavor. Overall, the meal was very good. Best of all was our waitress, really friendly gal with a lot of personality!

pAhWecogulFJwo5_Sr0QAw.text: I ended up meeting friends here on a Monday night after the group's first choice was too busy to accommodate us due to a private party.  I had driven by this place many times with the passive thought of trying them out one day.  I ordered the chicken tenders and tater tots, a safe choice I often order for a new-to-me place that has mixed reviews.  I enjoyed the chicken.  I can tell the chicken was fresh and not frozen.  The breading on the chicken was very light, yet flavorful.  This made the chicken moist and not greasy.  The server said there was a mixup in the kitchen and apologized for my tots coming out after my chicken tenders, and I appreciated that because I enjoy eating food that hasn't been sitting under a heat lamp.  Our server was able to keep up with our small group by making sure we had drinks and were still "satisfied."  I didn't find anything too special about this place which is why I'm giving it the three star review.

photos.caption: Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tater tots
Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken tenders, honey mustard

ct_6b5rfDPXMl5hSkNJsMw.text: Good place to stop on a rainy day  Had just got off of a plane after a long flight from San Diego.  My wife picked me up and I had picked out a restaurant I had wanted to try but when we got there, they were closed for repairs from Hurricane Florence.  Time for Plan B.   Had been here years ago. When it was built, it was across the street from the Charlotte Coliseum but that relocated years ago. Right off of Tyvola Road however so not hard to find.  It was pouring and while we made a wrong turn of two, we finally got there.  Got drenched coming up from our car but was warm and cozy of the inside  While we dried off, took a good lunch at the menu. Typical bar food but that's OK.  I had always want to try a Nashville Chicken Sandwich and since it was on the menu, decided to give it a try. My wife went with the Chicken Cordon Bleu Sandwich and both came with fries.  The Nashville Chicken was nice and spicy with a good heat and a kick. My wife's Sandwich was good but nothing to write home about.  Fries were good with a good balance of flavor and texture.  Service was pretty good but not outstanding despite the fact that it was mid afternoon and the place was mostly empty.  Atmosphere is typical sports bar.  For those of us who used to live in NE Ohio, this is a Cleveland Browns Sports Bar which did not go over well with my wife who is from Pittsburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

CSEAADlNfrMzBLnwkramSA.text: Had a very good experience here this evening. Our waitress Alyssa was very attentive and food was delicious.

Le9KaR5MlTkihvCiBH7UOg.text: These reviews are a lie! The food was HORRIBLE.... how do you mess up wings...you dip them in grease and sauce  them!!! Oh wait I know how you can... DON'T SAUCE THEM! How dare you have the nerve to also bring me watered down ranch...kettle chips weren't seasoned.. BUT WHYYYYYY. I was so hungry and KNEW I was going to get a great meal because of the reviews... service was great... beer was great.... it's sad when the best part of your meal is the celery!!! I've been bamboozled out of $30.... LIES LIES LIES... go get some gas station sushi instead!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Where&#39;s the sauce on the wings?
Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Oh!! These are their gourmet lemon pepper wings.... looks like they could only afford to give a &#34;splash&#34; of pepper!
Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. They didn&#39;t even season/salt the kettle chips!

zkN-PioUfK0F2UI_32tTbQ.text: I was in town for the night and this was close to my hotel. I ordered the club sandwich and broccoli instead of fries. Food came out quick and it was hot  and fresh. The beer was ice cold and the bartenders were extremely friendly and attentive. I will definitely be back next time I'm in town. Good job guys, keep up the good work.

photos.caption: Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

2wYSxkwTnsdea38piFlHyA.text: Completely underwhelming! Very disappointed that they made a salad taste awful. I had the chicken salad and the crispy green beans. The green beans were delicious...everything else was horrible. The chicken on my salad had grill marks but was ice cold the diced egg was watery just...ik!! Never again. The server was nice though.

photos.caption: Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. My husband waiting patiently for his meal unlike his wife who is hangry!!

dsPowuLSU4OiNTLvRKBmNA.text: Best sports bar I've been to in Charlotte. The service was courteous and prompt. Would definitely come back here again

SfHsl4lYTnXZDR3GelT-4Q.text: They have good food here the chicken wings are wonderful I ordered a salad I forgot what kind but it had all kind of goodies on it it was wonderful my brother got a Philly sandwich he said it was great and their fries are out of this world the waitress was nice I would recommend this place to anyone that loves sports and good food they had like five six different TVs on at one time all different sports games that we can watch all at once. I will say stop by and check it out

PhmFQ0sNYHMNbXT42fOLcA.text: This is your typical sports bar with screens everywhere serving your typical bar food. I will note that their floor is perpetually sticky for some reason. It's evident that they are not likely using a mop in this establishment.  Nonetheless, this place is tucked in the midst of multiple business parks so, if you work in the area, you're likely to see one of your coworkers here as well. They have a designated parking lot with plenty of spaces.  I've been a here a few times and each time, the host/hostess has always seemed less than thrilled to be greeting people. They offer a short lunch menu that provides offerings such as soup/half sandwich combo, pizza & salad, and few other things at a reduced menu price. The regular menu is also available.  I've had a chicken sandwich and fried chicken salad on the separate times I've been here. Neither was memorable but the fries were pretty good.  Due to the proximity to my office, it's part of the regular rotation but there are better options elsewhere.

JDQddgHnlSDMruOfB5FH0g.text: My server was the bomb dot com! I wanted to sub my ribs with brisket & my fries with sweet potato fries (which were tots served with cinnamon, not pictured). He brought my food out promptly & my drinks stay replenished. I was so full off of everything!! I am glad that I found a restaurant/bar close to my home with a comfortable setting. Def will be back to also try their drink menu & desserts.

photos.caption: Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Got the 1/2 rack &amp; shrimp but subbed for brisket...cause ain&#39;t nobody got time for bones lol my server is awesome!

hdUwy7MnBiwCJT5kWxQdBw.text: Always the best place to watch your favorite sports events! Lots of TVs. Great bar staff. Delicious food. I always get the Blue Chips to start. Homeade potato chips with gorgonzola dressing, tomatoes, crumbled gorgonzola, scallions and drizzled with buffalo sauce. Just an overall great atmosphere. 1 of the original sports bars in southwest Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blue Chips

LUXhhSqfcLnOg01oYwmHFw.text: In today for a few quick beers at Jocks and Jills. Chriss the bartender was awesome. Full bar,tons of to orders,picky ass customers and she kicked ass.Busy as hell.Always had a smile, pleasant personal interaction and kept things moving. Best bartender I've seen in awhile. No step or motion was wasted.Very efficient. Whatever they are paying her its not enough. If I ever decide to get back in the bar business she would be my first hire. Awesome job young lady.

BRf8g016IaPr6B2m2zOCaQ.text: This was decent. It's been years since we have been here because of the location. We were near here so figured we would check it out. Our waitress was very good. The sweet potato puffs were amazing. They serve them with brown sugar cinnamon. Yum. My daughter enjoyed her burger and my other liked her philly sandwich. I had shrimp- they were a little on the salty side and hubby had a turkey burger which he said was good. Decent.

photos.caption: Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried shrimp with cheese fries
Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheeseburger
Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey Burger

is9mrB1FVocX82UihhaiTg.text: Typical sports bar, with a solid selection of local beer. The wings were tasty. Looking to watch a game? Then this is the place.

HDzuiTCkGMpYuVFx9TfVHg.text: This is an okay place to come get a lunch with friends. They have specials for lunch that are reasonably priced. Food is what you would expect for a sports bar. Not bad, but not great. Our work group has been there several times and they have always been pleasant and served us in a reasonable time.

oOn_Axf8I83QO-AP7Ryt3Q.text: Good food.  Good service.  Friendly people.   Clean and fun atmosphere.  Some fun memorabilia around the place that's fun to look at there.  I had the steak salad which was delicious.

34PcueQx2pguk3QhZm3tug.text: Been here a few times as a go to spot after work since it's close and it's always a pleasant experience

hfKkDRzOc4mQVNTtFLbZFA.text: Ambience is great, I loved the sports Memorabilia.  The services was ok, I didn't feel welcomed but the waitress was courteous to standards, just not welcoming.  I ordered the grill chicken sandwich, it looked great. It just didn't have any flavor which means next time I would need to order something like avocado, extra pickles, or bbq sauce   The onion rings looked perfect,  but tasted bland.   I would come back to try something else on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sports Memorabilia is great
Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. It&#39;s good

btcDv9GhD7dJyGMq1MED3A.text: I come here every time I stay at the Renaissance Marriott! It has all the channels with any sport you like. Eric, the manager, is a great guy and always makes sure you watch the game you want!   The salads are surprisingly my favorite thing on the menu! The Bangkok Salad and the Fried chicken salads are awesome.  Great beer selection and just the perfect place for a meal on the road watching your favorite team and drinking a nice cold beer!

e9eyQKuoddxEFc4R2GG37A.text: I have to say Jocks n Jills used to be a good place.  For a sports bar, they used to have pretty good food but lately they have changed their menu for the worse.  My coworkers and I come here for lunch once in a while.  In the past year or so we've noticed the food and the service go completely down hill.  They used to have good fries, good wraps, good homemade potato chips., and above average food but that has since changed.    On a recent visit, the fries were worse than some fast food places, the chicken in a chicken enchilada was dry.  There was no salsa or tomatoes included in the poor attempt of additional toppings..,just shredded lettuce and a dollop of sour cream.  It was not very appetizing.    Service-wise, you better ask for a drink refill and your check when they bring out the food because servers have a tendency to disappear even when the restaurant is not busy.  Since today's visit my coworkers and I have crossed this one off the list of regular lunch spots.

eT4igWGz9pVgElGWo_M5ow.text: Excellent service,  wings medium are really hot to me but other than that,  love the place

46xn7V16M-hcivM1zHjzyQ.text: Great place to hangout,watch a game!  Great selection of drinks and appetizers.

KxF8W6wfgwzGC3ozVE3APA.text: Long gone are the days with the Hive across the street with a hoppin' Jocks and Jills for some post-game fun.  This place looks like it haz a sad now.  Dark, carpets are in need of cleaning or replacement, tables and chairs are wonky, booth seating has seen better days.  I work just down Tyvola and had not been for a few years, where it formerly was a pretty regular place to grab a quick lunch.  It was fine, nothing stellar, but it was fine for a quick, reasonably priced lunch.  I didn't see my old favorite of a fried chicken wrap on the menu, so I went with a fried chicken salad.  It was fine *shrug*.  Service was good enough and kept drinks filled and was prompt with getting us the check and processing payment.  It's a large restaurant with lots of seating, plenty of TV's throughout playing whatever version of a sport is on at the time.  It just seems J&J has lost it's buzzzzzzzzzzzz.    They do have quite a bit of outdoor seating, and they used to have TV's out there, though I didn't notice on the last trip if they were still there or not.  It was relatively busy for lunch, so they must still be doing okay with the office park crowd around here.  It was A-OK.

28mrTtNqfrc8pU5t5_09yA.text: I am giving it 5 stars because of he staff. Everyone that works here is super friendly and attentive. I sat at the bar and both bartenders introduced themselves to me by name and remembered mine the rest of the night. Food was above average but the service made it forgettable.

DJwcl0NAdo4MkZZc41sOCA.text: Food was pretty good but the service was so bad we couldn't stay. We waited over 20 minutes just to get a drink and by the time we got our order placed it was obvious the service was not going to improve so we changed our order to take out.  I would give them a pass if the place was busy but we were one of 2-3 groups at the restaurant. Unacceptable and I will not be back.

SGnSTlvA2SVE3XtKgcVhFg.text: Wings were awesome...and the service was great. Mike took good care of us. Will be back.

kaGUnNfGVZbGIaqadTXRfQ.text: Sometimes I wonder why people can't just appreciate a great sports bar.  If you want fancy food head to South Park.  If you want a quiet dinner...you may want to pass.  BUT if you want every sports game on a gagillion flat screens, a fun covered patio, great drink specials and the best tater tots in town than you have found the place.  I work across the street and this place really works on creating a "Cheer's" like environment.  Bartenders and regulars get to know you.  People do not feel strange sitting at the bar alone.  And I will admit to doing some of my online work here using the free WiFi.    Go...grab a cheap beer...watch a game...say hi to a bartender and EAT THE TOTS!

SWvMaixgRKi_UmqOwj3lVQ.text: Didn't think the food would be good but I tried the Philly steak sandwich and it was very good. Service was excellent.

goK5idIQG-pc69RKo2IQ1w.text: There is really nothing special about this place.  If you are at the Hyatt across the parking lot for a week due to a work conference, you get stuck with the overpriced and bland stuff in the hotel or the overpriced and bland stuff here.  In three straight days, their drink specials have been either Bud Light or Miller Lite (depending on the day) at $2 a pint. That's it. Happy hour is non-existant. Well drinks are $6 each. I'd expect to pay that downtown but not out here in the boonies.  In addition, the food is not seasoned. Nothing special about the burgers. Chips and fries are just thrown in a fryer and then on the plate. Servers don't care too much about you and largely ignore you.  About the only plus is the outdoor seating and large number of televisions. If you are in a car, you would be better off going some place else. Otherwise, if you are stranded in the hotel, just suck it up and wait to go back home.

YFxJLxu_Dj54ybH-S8GlyQ.text: This is a fairly typical sports bar, but I think they have a few more tv's than thet typical sports bar.  Service was fair for as busy as things were on this night.  I ordered a Turkey Burger with fries and a Caesar Side Salad.  Thankfully, they did bring out the salad before the burger.  Unfortunately, they use a spring mix as the base for their Caesar Salad, so along with romaine you also get leaf lettuce, sliced carrots and some purple onion.  So it's got a little more variety.  The turkey burger was above average and appeared to have been made by hand (as opposed to frozen).  They offer a cajun ranch dressing that went well with the turkey and even better with the fries.  The fries were of the shoestring type and were among the better-tasting sports bar fries I've had in my day.  It's a nice place to go to get your sports fix and it has your standard bar fare.  Service is nothing special, but it has the market on the area surrounding the airport.  I wouldn't go out of my way, but if you're in the area...

photos.caption: Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey Burger and Fries
Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Interior

rK-Rdrs2nDSvHlGztQ58Fw.text: The wait staff here is slow and sucks, with the exception of Christina (aka The word up girl).

0IxOthLPlVYCCDj-QyrP_A.text: I think this is a great place to watch a game, although it gets packed.  On a nice night if you can get outside, they have a pretty nice projection set up out back.  Otherwise, you can probably see 2-3 tv's from any seat in the place.  Foodwise, it's not the best of the bunch, but I usually get the ahi tuna salad.  It's a pretty sizeable portion and they use good healthy greens, and not too much iceberg. For lunch it's a tad long, but we went during March madness so I guess it was busy. Mainly we go when we want to catch a game.

EG5KDmZFFLEq65O4ddujAA.text: It's an ok place. Food was alright at best. Prices are good though, so I didn't feel like my money was completely wasted. Perfect place to go to after a long day at work. Good selection of beer and all.

fQSfoImDNoui4jjUBOFRrg.text: I've gotta agree with Ian M on this one...Jocks & Jills does the job. It fills the void of a sports bar with decent food, spacious booths, plenty of TV's (even on the patio) and friendly service. If you need a bar to catch a game, enter Jocks and Jills.    While there aren't any really special characteristics to this place, it's just fine overall. I snacked on a quesadilla and sampled hubs' turkey club. Both meals were just fine and quieted my rumbling stomach. I washed that down with a Blue Moon as the bar was out of champagne (for a mimosa) and Strongbow. Expect fairly priced eats to go along with your TV eye.   And hey - they have sweet potato tots. That's a win on its own!

U38ReBokul72nCtGBgzGww.text: Not bad for a beer and burger at the bar if you're on a business trip. I'm sure there's better choices in the area though.

TjfarLCP6GqVIUtaIXeNhw.text: Located across from the old Coliseum, this place used to be packed out all of the time. Now most of their customers are the work crowds on lunch break. While this place isn't anything too special in the food department (mainly above average bar food), it's not a bad place to either sit outside or catch a game. They have tons of tv's without a really bad view in the house. It's always packed for lunch but the line usually goes pretty quickly.  I'd check out Jock's & Jill's if you were in the area for lunch one day but probably wouldn't head that direction just to go there.

photos.caption: Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Entrance

zz02XeO3LC2iSGHwZwp9iw.text: Pretty average. Was told by the waitress the burger was fresh ground beef (never frozen) and they cut/smoked their own bacon. Should have known better but trusted the statement. Was cheap thin basic microwaved bacon and not sure about the burger but if it was fresh ground they need to find a new source.

zXSk0d7mQnYzjO2UE--WDQ.text: I don't recommend it. Not good. Gave them 2 chances and both times sucked. The sandwiches are always dry. Also, the hostesses don't seem to be very well trained. I went during lunch by myself and was told it would be about a 20min wait, so I sat at the bar. I walk back and can count 5 or 6 small tables that are wide open. Both visits I left feeling "blah" like I needed to eat lunch again somewhere else.

Sy7Kzl0uZLK4ytUGaWxv6A.text: I wasnt inpressed. I was in Charlotte for business and stayed at the Hyatt Place and Jocks was in the same parking lot.   I went with 2 of my coworkers. I had the steak salad and tater tots. I love me some tots. I also had a a Michelob Ultra. My coworkers had s philly cheese steak, chili and a fried chicken salad. It is all typical pub food.   My salad lettuce was wilted. The steak wasnt seasoned very well. The tots were veey crispy and good.   My coworkers all agreed that their food was just ok.  The bill was average.  The service was friendly but a little slow.   The place seemed a little depressed.  I probably would only go back if i was ataying in the same hotel and was tired and just wanted a burger or wings.

Blxrf2JAyXubqAleqwyDDw.text: I work literally next door, yet we always forget about Jocks & Jills when it comes to lunch.  They have good lunch specials (I got a meatball sub & fries for about $5), but its nothing to write home about.    You can reserve tables/rooms for groups which is nice when a large work group is coming, but don't expect to get in and out quickly.

H_PgpLgNTP6rKFs7Lt9AtQ.text: The food is great and much better then McKoy's Smokehouse a few miles down the road. The service is also very good! The ribs are the best thing in the menu. Lots of beers on tap, you also can't beat $2.75 draft day on Tuesday.

grToUJ2I38psu3SJuVKPgw.text: Great little bar/restaurant, the philly cheesesteak was very tasty and the beer selection is nice.  Worth the visit.

DrZSQAXd5xDE7C-aciUziA.text: No way is this place as good as Barney's Beanery back home, but with only an hour left before they closed, the bartender took care of us with food & drinks, no problem. My only complaint is, why are all the televisions tuned to the same channel? Lame.  Have the onion rings! Seriously, the BEST I've ever had. Great, now I'm sure someone is gonna challenge me on this one later on down the line, but, whatever, dude!

photos.caption: Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. A side dinner salad for 2.99. Look, Ma! I&#39;m eating my vegetables!!
Photo of Jocks & Jills Sports Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jack &amp; Diet. Perfect mix.

ye6HNPvSxQ3R1TWuNdk2PQ.text: Its ok pub food. I have had decent experiences here. Its close to my job so its convenient.  The inside is a little dark.

9RKTSf6KpsBWajspcsBc4w.text: Good beer selection, variety of American food. Good atmosphere with tons or TV's. There is no bad seat to see a TV.  Walking distance to Hotel.

rVP8XSiEzEkJfvHogEwq5w.text: Waiting here for 10 minutes now and no one has waited on me. This is frustrating. Not a drink or a menu. Beware people.

TzwywiYqRuE_i7_vscLA7Q.text: Had an early dinner here last night and the salmon entree is hands down the best I've had anywhere. My server Quinn said it was her favorite and that I wouldn't be disappointed. She was correct!  I wasn't able to last night, but I will be back to enjoy the $2.75 draft beer deal they had going on.

HoasXFHffbDRkpYrgo7c2Q.text: Great food.  Great prices.  Appropriate for big groups, families, or date night. Emily served us and she was fantastic.

m1sW3OWoDOUaRcasi5N4Mw.text: First impression was great. The bartender was attentive and quick with a beer. Plenty of screens for sports. A bit slow on a Friday night.  The food: I only had chicken nachos. They came out super fast (5 minutes tops). So the chicken was obviously not fresh grilled, and they used liquid nacho cheese instead of melting shredded cheese. I was hungry. So, I got past those thoughts and they went down just fine.

wtLnTtMRbkK02bhXW8_uNw.text: Tons of TVs with run of the mill food bar food. Service is consistent, beers are cheap and there are tons of screens to watch sports on.   I've sampled a few different items but nothing has blown my mind. I do like the sweet potato tots though. The cajun chicken sandwich wasn't bad but I wish the bottom piece of bread didn't come out soggy.  They have a large dining area, bar seating, a private room that you can reserve if you are bringing a large group and a pretty nice patio with TVs.   If you are looking for a sports bar in the area Jocks & Jills is a decent choice.

35XhUykGWF8GsE_1pLc4FA.text: After a long drive from NJ to our hotel in the same parking lot, this place was lit up like a much needed oasis. We arrived after 10:00 pm and promptly greeted and seated by our awesome server Mike. My daughter ordered an amazing steak that was cooked perfectly since she likes her beef 'mooing'.  Her onion rings and accompanying sauce was epic. My wife had this fantastic pulled pork sandwich and I had the best burger sliders in a long time. Even the honey mustard and BBQ sauce was epic. Since we might be relocating to the Charlotte area, I am glad we can return.  But the highlight was Mike and his service, made us feel right at home and was very attentive. Thanks!

b21HMfRR5Thd0ITN4t_SDA.text: They're not very organized for watching games at all. There are 200 televisions in this place and seven NFL games playing but nowhere in the place can you find a television where I could hear my game. It's just not very well-designed is laid out so the TVs are all far away and some of them are analog quality.

19BO77cja7LJJXZOMrN_Ig.text: Was in Charlotte for business and ate here with a few co - workers.  Other than the local copper beer I had, I can't really find anything else good to say about this place.   Sad considering I could have gotten the same beer elsewhere.  I have no intention of going back to this place.   I got wings and in the picture on the menu photos it looked tasty, and the waiter noted they had decent heat in their jot sauce.   Well the pictures were deceiving as I have had chicken nuggets bigger and better than those wings.  Also the sauce was horrible, and I have had hotter banana pepper rings.   Overall just a bad experience.

WNmneFykTnHPsbwhz9Isxw.text: NOT your typical sports bar! The food is good, menu varied, fare is extremely economical and staff is super friendly.   Right side of the restaurant has lively feel to it and a bar. left side is quieter with booths perfect for breakfast... And in the summer we all show up to hang out on the deck with our dogs;)   This is a place where you can count on a very economical meal of solid favorites like wings, fish tacos, nachos and more.   The staff remember regulars and go out of their way to make folks feel at home.  Who does that anymore?   I for one love this place - I've had fancy shmancy all over the world and it's overrated.    Welcome home to J&Js ~

AAvAlGShIxDa8jG81hkOgA.text: Met a friend for a quick lunch.  I got there early, which rarely ever happens so I sat at the bar for probably 15 minutes.  They had my favorite beer on draft (which I can't get in CT where I live) so I had to get one, even though it was lunch on a Tuesday. :)  Compared to pints in the Northeast, $3 felt like a steal!  The bartender was friendly and fast with service. Once my friend arrived, we moved over to a regular table outside the bar.  We each got a lunch special... her, a cup of chili and a half sandwich; me, the grilled fish tacos.  She seemed to enjoy her, complimenting what a great price it was and the perfect amount of food for lunch.  My tacos were great!  I loved that the fish was grilled and came with rice and black beans.  The salsa and toppings were fresh.  The table service was fast and courteous.

jjmCuEyfuU92AtTzLdPdIQ.text: Good selection of drafts on menu and awesome starters .. Don't mis their crispy beans

1wm_itKRpTcUSZ1zy5g0sg.text: Do yourself a favor, and do not order the Philly Cheesesteak.  Onion rings were decent.

E_2ZT-AjmxfJW12Q8qLKhw.text: Great service, great food, great atmosphere.   The bartenders are wonderful and would recommend everyone giving this place a try
